name: 5'nizza
description:
'''5'nizza''' (slang spelling of {{langx|uk|п'ятниця}} {{IPA|uk|ˈpjɑtnɪtsʲɐ||uk-п’ятниця.ogg}}, meaning "Friday") is an [[acoustic music|acoustic]] group formed in 2000 in [[Kharkiv]], [[Ukraine]] that disbanded in 2007 and reunited in 2015. It is made up of friends [[Serhii Babkin]] ({{lang|uk|Сергій Бабкін}}, guitar), and Andrii "Sun" Zaporozhets ({{lang|uk|Андрій Запорожець}}, vocals).

The band's music has a combination of influences: [[reggae]], [[Latin American music|Latin]], [[rock (music)|rock]] and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]], which is performed in a minimalistic [[folk music|folk]] style limited to vocals, [[beatboxing]], and [[acoustic guitar]]. Despite lack of support from large labels, the group attracted [[cult following]] in much of [[Central Europe|Central]] and [[Eastern Europe]], notably Ukraine, Russia, [[Belarus]], [[Poland]] and [[Germany]].

5'nizza's song "{{lang|uk|Натяни}}" ("''Natyany''") was featured on [[American Idol (season 16)|American Idol, Season 16]] Episode 2, on March 12, 2018 in the USA on ABC Television, when sung by Idol contestant Misha Gontar. Although the judges were intrigued by his Ukrainian rap, he was not invited to continue in the competition.
